main event: Two sergeants spotted an unidentified flying object over Benedict, Maryland on June 22, 1952, describing it as circular and colored silvery with orange hues, performing unusual maneuvers.
interesting points: The object was first seen traveling from north to south at an estimated speed of 200-300 knots., The object came to a complete stop overhead and then oscillated before moving in a straight line., It performed a 180-degree turn, climbing in a spiral before disappearing completely., Witnesses reported no sounds during the observation., The meteorological conditions at the time of the sighting reported clear visibility with no unusual weather.
witness description: two sergeants from the VYA-212 Operations Office
